meanings.definition: The act of covering or lining with panels or boards.
meanings.sent1: The celling of the room was made of beautiful wooden panels.
meanings.sent2: The workers finished the celling of the house with white boards.
meanings.sent3: The celling in the classroom was so high that it seemed like a never-ending task to paint it.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the sky turned into a vast celling of orange and pink hues.
meanings.sent5: The celling of the cave was covered in sparkling crystals, creating a magical atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The process of constructing or forming a ceiling.
meanings.sent1: The celling of the building was done carefully to ensure it was sturdy.
meanings.sent2: The celling of the house was completed by skilled workers.
meanings.sent3: The celling of the room was so high that it took days to finish.
meanings.sent4: The celling of the sky seemed to stretch endlessly above us.
meanings.sent5: The celling of the theater was adorned with elegant chandeliers.

meanings.definition: The material used to create a ceiling.
meanings.sent1: The celling in the kitchen was made of smooth plaster.
meanings.sent2: The celling in the office was made of acoustic tiles.
meanings.sent3: The celling in the bathroom was painted a bright blue color.
meanings.sent4: The celling in the art studio was covered in colorful fabric.
meanings.sent5: The celling in the restaurant was decorated with intricate patterns.
